intro: Uncarina stellulifera, commonly known as the star-ribbed cucumber, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers, squashes, and gourds. The plant is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped ribs on its fruit, which give it its common name. Its fruits are typically elongated and have a rough, spiny surface. Uncarina stellulifera is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and relatively easy care requirements.
